heisig_chinese_memo: A bit of old food is stuck on one of my mandalas. What could it be? I scrape it off and taste it . . . Hmm, bean jam bread, I reckon.
Ru_trainchinese: mán: (графема) хлебец, приготовленный на пару
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the wide (曼) food (𩙿) is steamed dumplings
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You can't meditate in front of the mandala if you are too full so just eat some light food like a small slice of bread.
humanum_full_description_en: From the " food ", " Man " sound, and " head " conjunction, "bread" fermented flour steamed food, said this had stuffing, today most regions, said no stuffing as bread, have stuffing for the dumplings, Wu District There are stuffing and no stuffing collectively called steamed bread. "Ji Yun‧ Huan Yun": "Ban, steamed buns, cakes." Song Gaocheng "Jiyuan of Things, Drinks and Drinks, Steamed Breads": "The Barnyard Official's Novel Cloud: Zhuge Wuhou’s Conquest of Meng Huo, people say: "There are so many evil arts in the land , You must pray to the gods, and the fake Yin soldiers will help them. However, the vulgar will kill people, with its first sacrifice, and the gods will send troops to it." Wuhou refused, because of the mixed use of the meat of the sheep The face is like a human head and an ancestral temple. The gods also send troops to Yan, and later generations are steamed buns."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " food ", " Man " sound, and " head " conjunction, "bread" fermented flour steamed food, said this had stuffing, today most regions, said no stuffing as bread, have stuffing for the dumplings, Wu District There are stuffing and no stuffing collectively called steamed bread.
humanum_full_description: 從「食」，「曼」聲，與「頭」連用，「饅頭」表示用麵粉發酵蒸成的食品，本有餡，今多數地區稱無餡為饅頭，有餡為包子，吳語區則有餡無餡統稱饅頭。《集韻‧桓韻》：「饅，饅頭，餅也。」宋高承《事物紀原‧酒醴飲食‧饅頭》：「稗官小說云：諸葛武侯之征孟獲，人曰：『蠻地多邪術，須禱於神，假陰兵一以助之。然蠻俗必殺人，以其首祭之，神則向之，為出兵也。』武侯不從，因雜用羊豕之肉，而包之以麵，象人頭，以祠。神亦向焉，而為出兵。後人由此為饅頭。」
humanum_short_description: 從「食」，「曼」聲，與「頭」連用，「饅頭」表示用麵粉發酵蒸成的食品，本有餡，今多數地區稱無餡為饅頭，有餡為包子，吳語區則有餡無餡統稱饅頭。

從「 食 」，「 曼 」聲，與「 頭 」連用，「饅頭」表示用麵粉發酵蒸成的食品，本有餡，今多數地區稱無餡為饅頭，有餡為包子，吳語區則有餡無餡統稱饅頭。《集韻‧桓韻》：「饅，饅頭，餅也。」宋高承《事物紀原‧酒醴飲食‧饅頭》：「稗官小說云：諸葛武侯之征孟獲，人曰：『蠻地多邪術，須禱於神，假陰兵一以助之。然蠻俗必殺人，以其首祭之，神則向之，為出兵也。』武侯不從，因雜用羊豕之肉，而包之以麵，象人頭，以祠。神亦向焉，而為出兵。後人由此為饅頭。」
From the " food", " Man" sound, and " head" conjunction, "bread" fermented flour steamed food, said this had stuffing, today most regions, said no stuffing as bread, have stuffing for the dumplings, Wu District There are stuffing and no stuffing collectively called steamed bread. "Ji Yun‧ Huan Yun": "Ban, steamed buns, cakes." Song Gaocheng "Jiyuan of Things, Drinks and Drinks, Steamed Breads": "The Barnyard Official's Novel Cloud: Zhuge Wuhou’s Conquest of Meng Huo, people say: "There are so many evil arts in the land , You must pray to the gods, and the fake Yin soldiers will help them. However, the vulgar will kill people, with its first sacrifice, and the gods will send troops to it." Wuhou refused, because of the mixed use of the meat of the sheep The face is like a human head and an ancestral temple. The gods also send troops to Yan, and later generations are steamed buns."

饅字的基本解释

饅
mán

饅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mán］
［《廣韻》母官切，平桓，明。］
“馒1”的繁体字。
见“饅頭”。

饅字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【食字部】　饅； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1424第24
【廣韻】母官切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】謨官切，?音瞞。【集韻】饅頭，餠也。【正字通】麫食也。饅開首者曰橐駝臍。吳下呼?膪，讀若匘詐，言熟食之肥也。長曰繭，斜曰桃。【晉·書束晳賦】饅頭薄持。【事物紀原】諸葛亮南征，將渡瀘水。土俗殺人首祭神，亮令以羊豕代，取麫，畫人頭祭之。饅頭名始此，又南唐有子母饅頭。【燕翼詒謀錄】仁宗誕日，賜羣臣包子，卽饅頭別名。今俗屑麫發酵，或有餡，或無餡，烝食者謂之饅頭。　【集韻】或作?。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xujixia] [Shizi Department] 　 Man; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: Page 1424-24
[Guang Yun] Mother official cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Mo official cut,? Yin concealed. [Jiyun] Steamed buns, 餠也. [Zhengzitong] Food is also available. The man who started the steamed bun said the navel of the camel. Wu Xia called out to be fattened, reading it as a swindle, saying that cooked food is fat. Long said cocoon, obliquely said peach. [Jin·Shu Shuxi Fu] Steamed buns are thinly held. [Things of the original] Zhuge Liang's southern expedition, will cross Lushui. The local custom kills people first to sacrifice to the gods, and Liangling replaces them with sheep and hogs, takes the noodles, and draws the heads to sacrifice them. The name of the steamed bun started here, and there were son-mother steamed buns in Southern Tang Dynasty. [Swallow Wing Yimou Lu] On the birthday of Renzong, gift buns to all the ministers and alias for steamed buns. Today's common crumbs are fermented, with or without stuffing, and people who eat it are called steamed buns.　【Jiyun】or make?.
